text: , usually called is an airport in Tokyo, Japan.Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, and Transport (MLIT), Tokyo International (Haneda) Airport; retrieved 2012-1-20. It is one of the two main airports in the Greater Tokyo Area. Two of Japan's major airlines, Japan Airlines and All Nippon Airways, are based in Haneda Airport. Other Japanese airlines are also based in Haneda. Haneda was the main international airport in Tokyo up to 1978. After that, most domestic flights to and from Tokyo stayed at Haneda, and most international flights moved to Narita International Airport. The airport is in ÅŒta, Tokyo, south of Tokyo Station. Access to the airport by train starts at Hamamatsucho Station or at Shinagawa Station. == Related pages == * List of airports in Japan ==References== ==Other websites== *https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/realtime/?fbclid=IwAR1Nb9AYz7AeYFFYZtfgcOwbZ3OU- Hu_Kj_R5ngl22flXwP0dUIQGaQmTLo * Haneda Airport ; * Haneda Tokyo Airport * Haneda Airport Access Guide Category:Airports in Japan Category:Buildings and structures in Tokyo Category:Tokyo Prefecture
title: Haneda Airport
